This function also sets the Wikipedia article globally. To change the article, you will need to run search again with a new topic.

(3) similar; which returns a list of articles that may be similar to the article set by the most recent search function.

Question: Chimaja Appawas the younger brother of a general of the Maratha Empire in India, who served as what to the fifth Maratha Chhatrapati Shahu from 1720 until his death?

Observation 1: Chimaji Appa, also known as Bhau, played a significant role in capturing the Vasai fort from the Portuguese. He concentrated his efforts on the Western Ghats, with Vasai being the main target due to its importance as the capital of the Portuguese's northern Indian state. The Court ruled that unless a suspect explicitly states they are relying on their right to remain silent, their voluntary statements can be used in court. Observation 2: The case of Mississippi University for Women v. Hogan was decided 5-4 by the Supreme Court of the United States, ruling that the single-sex admissions policy of the university violated the Equal Protection Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment. The ruling led to the university changing its policies to allow the admission of qualified males into all programs, without requiring the entire university to become coeducational. Despite the ruling, the school's name remained "Mississippi University for Women," and efforts to change it faced opposition.
Thought 3: Both Berghuis v. Thompkins and Mississippi University for Women v. Hogan were decided 5-4 by the Supreme Court of the United States. The original question asked which one was decided 5-4, so the answer is both cases.

Solve a question answering task with interleaving Thought, Action, Observation steps. Thought can reason about the current situation, and Action can be four types: 

(1) search | topic | guiding_question; which searches the closest article to the topic on Wikipedia and returns the sentences related to the guiding_question if it exists. If no such article exists, it will return a list of articles that may be similar. You can then use the search function on these articles if you wish. This function also sets the Wikipedia article globally. To change the article, you will need to run search again with a new topic.

(2) crawl | guiding_question; which searches through the current Wikipedia article (the one set by the previous search function) for titles of other articles that are very closely related to the inputted guiding_question.

(3) similar; which returns a list of articles that may be similar to the article set by the most recent search function.

(4) finish | answer; which returns the answer and finishes your Thought, Action, Observation task.



Note that you may make your guiding_question for each action as detailed as you wish, or not. Use your thought steps to come up with a good guiding_question.

Solve a question answering task with interleaving Thought, Action, Observation steps. Thought can reason about the current situation, and Action can be four types: 

(1) search | topic | guiding_question; which searches the closest article to the topic on Wikipedia and returns the sentences related to the guiding_question if it exists. If no such article exists, it will return a list of articles that may be similar. You can then use the search function on these articles if you wish. This function also sets the Wikipedia article globally. To change the article, you will need to run search again with a new topic.

(2) crawl | guiding_question; which searches through the current Wikipedia article (the one set by the previous search function) for titles of other articles that are very closely related to the inputted guiding_question.

(3) similar; which returns a list of articles that may be similar to the article set by the most recent search function.

(4) finish | answer; which returns the answer and finishes your Thought, Action, Observation task.



Note that you may make your guiding_question for each action as detailed as you wish, or not. Use your thought steps to come up with a good guiding_question.
